page.title: 16NEWTONMORE, THE VILLAGE 2
page.content: cont./ The railway came in 1863 and Newtonmore's population grew. Each house originally had access for cows to the pasturage beside the Spey, called "The Acres". On part of this meadow ground the golf course was laid out . The Golf Course has come to be an important asset to the tourist trade which has developed over the last hundred years. Tourism is now the main industry and the main source of income - the Village has fifteen hotels and guest houses. Pony trekking was first promoted here in 1952. The sporting estates and hill farms of the country westwards towards Laggan keep communication links through Newtonmore. The road has steadily grown in importance and the major reconstruction of the A9 main trunk (over the last seven years) has seen the road bypass the village.
